New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit the fastest pitch recorded in MLB history
Ohtani finished the night 1-for-5 while his 98 RBIs tied him with Marcell Ozuna of the Atlanta Braves for the NL lead
Key Match Events: Tommy Edman broke a 6-6 tie with a two-run single in the top of the ninth inning
Ohtani hit a game-tying sacrifice fly in the second inning after Arizona turned a 3-0 deficit into a 4-3 lead
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani hit his National League-leading 44th homer and drove in two runs in the Los Angeles Dodgers' 8-6 win over the Arizona Diamondbacks on Saturday
The Dodgers extended their NL West lead to six games by taking the first two of a four-game set against the second-place D-backs at Chase Field
